description: Mitchell's family and attorneys said a settlement was reached with the operator of a Milwaukee hotel where he was detained by security guards. The attorneys declined to disclose the settlement amount.
title: A settlement is reached in D'Vontaye Mitchell's death. Here's what we know

description: California has passed a package of bills targeting for shoplifters. It's a shift towards tough-on-crime policies for the state that reduced penalties for crimes in recent years.
title: California is stiffening the punishment for theft-related crimes

description: For the first time, hundreds of social media creators were invited to cover the DNC. We talk to one creator, Olivia Julianna, who's not just making content but speaking Wednesday night at the DNC.
title: From Social Media Creator to DNC Speaker, a 21 year old takes the stage

description: Israeli forces recover the bodies of six hostages in Gaza. The families of the hostages say all were kidnapped alive in the Hamas-led attack on Oct. 7 — they died while they were being held.
title: Israel has recovered the bodies of six hostages from Gaza

description: Ukraine needs more soldiers as its troops hold the defense on Ukrainian territory and carry out an offensive in Russia. An elite Ukrainian military unit offers civilians a one-week tryout as soldiers.
title: Ukraine civilians try the army for a week

description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with David Plouffe, former advisor to President Barack Obama, about joining the Harris/Walz campaign.
title: Former Obama advisor on what's in store for the Harris-Walz campaign

description: Former President Donald Trump is traveling across the country this week to highlight what he sees as the differences between his campaign and the Harris-Walz ticket. He's in Michigan on Tuesday.
title: Trump's message in Michigan during the DNC

description: A memorial exhibit for the 400 people killed and taken hostage at the Nova Music Festival in Israel on Oct. 7 has opened in Southern California. Synagogues are taking groups to the installation.
title: A new memorial in LA honors the concert goers killed in Oct. 7 attack on Israel

description: Kate Cox was in the middle of a pregnancy emergency when the Texas Supreme Court denied her an abortion. Now, she's a Democratic activist who will speak at the DNC.
title: Kate Cox is one of the people speaking about their abortion experiences at the DNC

description: Just a few miles from the site of the Democratic National Convention, a mobile health clinic opened its doors for patients seeking reproductive health care including vasectomies and abortion pills.
title: From vasectomies to abortion pills, Planned Parenthood sets up mobile clinic near DNC

description: Former President Barack Obama and former first lady Michelle Obama will take the stage, along with second gentleman Doug Emhoff and others on Tuesday night.
title: Here’s who’s speaking on Day 2 of the DNC

description: The Israeli military recovered the bodies of six hostages taken to Gaza in Hamas' Oct. 7 attack. Hamas says some captives have been killed and wounded in Israeli airstrikes.
title: Israel says it recovered 6 hostages' bodies in Gaza

description: President Biden received a standing ovation at the DNC's first night. Outside, protestors tried to get into the secure perimeter.
title: Biden gets hero’s welcome. And, protesters pull down fencing to get into the DNC

description: Some people regard these protests as a kind of test for Chicago police, which has been under pressure in recent years to reform. How did they do on their first full day of the convention?
title: Protesters show up at DNC to oppose U.S. back for Israel in its war in Gaza

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with Democrat Pete Buttigieg about President Biden's legacy, and the goals and strategies of the Democratic National Convention.
title: Pete Buttigieg, who ran for the president nomination in 2020, to speak at the DNC

description: The Biden-Harris administration has a new initiative called "Time Is Money."
title: The White House plan to stop companies from wasting our time

description: The members want to galvanize support for Vice President Harris among Republicans wary of former President Donald Trump, but are reluctant to vote against the party they’ve long belonged to.
title: 'Republicans for Harris' coalitions have launched in several swing states

description: As Vice President Harris tries to become the first female president, her husband, Doug Emhoff would make history too — as the first, first gentleman.
title: America’s first second gentleman gets his turn on center stage tonight

description: Vice President Harris’ running mate has lived in China and traveled there many times. His relationship with the country has been under scrutiny, especially from Republicans.
title: Tim Walz made an impression in China, students and teachers say

description: Fans who traveled hundreds of miles to see the pop superstar are asking for another opportunity to see her in concert. The concerts who canceled because of terror threats.
title: After Taylor Swift canceled 3 shows in Vienna, there's been little blowback from fans

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says Israel has agreed to a cease-fire proposal for the war in Gaza. That announcement came after he met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyhu in Jerusalem.
title: Blinken heads to Egypt and Qatar to try to seal Gaza cease-fire deal

description: European Union leaders shun Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, but he enjoys a friendly relationship with former President Donald Trump.
title: Why Trump is lavishing praise on Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban

description: In a night "For the People," Democrats focused on the legacy of the Biden presidency as President Biden passed the torch to Vice President Harris.
title: Biden caps off a career in public service as Democrats celebrate his legacy at DNC

description: Night 1 featured a number of Democratic heavy-hitters, many of whom focused on the political and civil rights leaders who came before, making the nomination of Vice President Kamala Harris possible.
title: WATCH: AOC, Jasmine Crockett, the Bidens and Harris address Night 1 of the DNC

description: Monday evening’s first celebrity musical guest, country singer Mickey Guyton, sang her 2021 song “All American” to a rousing response.
title: Here's who performed (and who got bumped) on the first night of the DNC

description: Foxx described her childhood — being raised by a single mom, growing up in public housing and going to Planned Parenthood for health services
title: Gen Z activist Deja Foxx is the first content creator to speak at the convention

description: Ashley Biden, the youngest child of President Biden, painted a more personal picture of her father, sharing stories of him as a parent and as a political figure.
title: Ashley Biden, the president's daughter, paints a personal picture of her father's commitment

description: Clinton, who lost to former President Donald Trump in 2016, walked onto stage to the song "Brave" by Sara Bareilles, and used her time at the podium to push for a message of unity and progress. She praised President Biden, calling him a "true patriot" and thanking him for his service before moving onto "a new chapter in America's story."
title: In a full-circle moment, former nominee Hillary Clinton speaks in support of Harris

description: This was the congresswoman's first major convention speech, for which she was given a primetime slot. In 2020, Ocasio-Cortez addressed the DNC crowd with a pre-recorded minute-and-a-half-long endorsement for Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders.
title: AOC speaks to the middle class in her first major convention appearance

description: Waters, 86, told the story of Fannie Lou Hamer, a Black activist from Mississippi who fought for a seat at the 1964 Democratic National Convention. She brought the moment full circle to Harris, who is the first Black woman to be nominated by a major party for president.
title: WATCH: Rep. Maxine Waters endorses Kamala Harris in her remarks at the DNC night 1

description: Harris addressed the crowd and the raucous applause saying she wanted to kick off the convention by paying tribute to President Biden.
title: Kamala Harris makes a surprise appearance on the first night of the DNC

description: Weather conditions on the East Coast forced some flight cancellations to Chicago late Sunday night — including the flight that two New York delegates, Erik Bottcher and Allen Roskoff, along with Shaun Abreu, who is a member of the DNC Rules Committee, were supposed to be on.
title: Their flight was cancelled, so these delegates mounted a road trip to the DNC

description: On top of a historically short rise to the nomination, Harris' candidacy comes extremely late in the presidential campaign. Here's how it compares to past presidential tickets.
title: Harris clinched the nomination in 16 days — the fastest in more than three decades
